patches.summary: The consonantal כרת is the standard covenant verb — 'cut a covenant,' not 'be cut off.' Messiah vanishes like Enoch (Gen 5:24), not killed.

find.kjv: shall Messiah{H4899} be cut off{H3772}{(H8735)}, but not for himself: and
find.akjv: shall Messiah{H4899} be cut off{H3772}, but not for himself: and
find.asv: shall the anointed{H4899} one be cut off,{H3772} and shall have nothing: and
find.dbt: shall Messiah be cut off, and shall have nothing; and
find.drb: Christ shall be slain: and the people that shall deny him shall not be his. And
find.jps: shall an anointed one be cut off, and be no more; and
find.slt: Messiah shall be cut off, and not for him: and
find.wbt: shall Messiah be cut off, but not for himself: and
find.ylt: cut off is Messiah, and the city and the holy place are not his, the Leader who hath come doth destroy the people

replace.kjv: shall Messiah{H4899} cut{H3772} [a covenant] and vanish{H369} to himself;
replace.akjv: shall Messiah{H4899} cut{H3772} [a covenant] and vanish{H369} to himself;
replace.asv: shall the anointed{H4899} one cut{H3772} [a covenant] and vanish{H369} to himself;
replace.dbt: shall Messiah cut [a covenant] and vanish to himself;
replace.drb: Christ shall cut [a covenant] and vanish to himself;
replace.jps: shall an anointed one cut [a covenant] and vanish;
replace.slt: Messiah shall cut [a covenant] and vanish to himself;
replace.wbt: shall Messiah cut [a covenant] and vanish to himself;
replace.ylt: Messiah cuts [a covenant] and vanishes — to himself, and the city, and the holy place; he will destroy the people of the coming ruler

patches.summary: The Hebrew verb ישחית is singular — 'he will destroy,' not 'they.' Traditional translations rearrange the Hebrew word order.

find.kjv: the people{H5971} of the prince{H5057} that shall come{H935}{(H8802)} shall destroy{H7843}{(H8686)} the city{H5892} and the sanctuary{H6944}

find.dbt: the people of the prince that shall come shall destroy the city and the sanctuary
find.drb: a people with their leader that shall come, shall destroy the city and the sanctuary

find.slt: the people of the leader coming shall destroy the city and the holy place
find.wbt: the people of the prince that shall come shall destroy the city and the sanctuary

patches.summary: The consonants שבעים appear twice identically — only vowel points distinguish 'weeks' from 'seventy.' Smith's Literal independently reads 'Seventy seventy.'
